summary:
Inktober day 22: expensive Oh
your strength takes my breath away. There is beauty in your stance, love in
your crystalline...
caption:
Inktober day 22: expensive

Oh your strength takes my breath away.
There is beauty in your stance, love in your crystalline tears, care in every laugh that resonates within my very soul.
Smile not for me, but for all who long to feel the rays of warmth.
What have I done to deserve your joy directed upon me?

-
Reference for the nice drink used from my pal eacocktails at instagram.
If you’re a fan of aesthetics and cocktails drop by.

summary: Thursdays With Peter - Chapter 1 - Sandylee007 - The Avengers (Marvel Movies) [Archive of Our Own]
body:
Thursdays With Peter - Chapter 1 - Sandylee007 - The Avengers (Marvel Movies) [Archive of Our Own]

If you ever feel like a good cry, this fic might be the way to go. No one is a super hero in this version but the relationships are still very much real and so very special. As of now, it’s not completed. The writer seems to love stabbing my heart. But I’m holding out a little hope despite the very bold archive warning. Get your tissues or shirt sleeve ready.

@Sandylee007

summary: Of Scarlet Witches and Iron Men
title: Of Scarlet Witches and Iron Men
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2CZxbQ2

by Marionette01

In one timeline, Wanda Maximoff dies during “The Snap”. In this one, she is one of the few remaining Avengers. With the help of Scott Lang, Wanda managed to go back in time, to the HYDRA bunker with a mission to change the future.

Words: 514, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, Iron Man (Movies), X-Men - All Media Types, Young Avengers (Comics)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence
  • Characters: Wanda Maximoff, Tony Stark, Billy Kaplan, Tommy Shepherd, Vision (Marvel), Pepper Potts, James “Rhodey” Rhodes, Harley Keener, Peter Parker, May Parker (Spider-Man)
  • Relationships: Wanda Maximoff & Tony Stark, Tony Stark & Stark Robots, Peter Parker & Tony Stark, Pepper Potts & Tony Stark, James “Rhodey” Rhodes & Tony Stark, Billy Kaplan & Tommy Shepherd, Billy Kaplan & Wanda Maximoff, Wanda Maximoff & Tommy Shepherd, Harley Keener & Tony Stark, May Parker (Spider-Man) & Peter Parker, Wanda Maximoff & Vision
  • Additional Tags: Time Travel Fix-It, or an attempt, Tony Stark Has A Heart, Tony Stark Needs a Hug, BAMF Wanda Maximoff, Protective Pepper Potts, Protective James “Rhodey” Rhodes, Tony Stark Acting as Peter Parker’s Parental Figure

title: In the Wake of Adversity
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2PJvedo

by amethyst-noir (Arbonne)

Tony and the Cloak are too late to save Stephen from Ebony Maw’s torture. Now it falls to Tony and his new ghostly companion to correct a timeline gone horrible wrong and find a happy end for themselves.

Words: 7755, Chapters: 2/2, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies), Iron Man (Movies), Doctor Strange (2016)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Tony Stark, Stephen Strange
  • Relationships: Tony Stark/Stephen Strange
  • Additional Tags: Cloak of Levitation (Marvel), Vague descriptions of torture, as seen in Infinity War, nothing worse, Alternative Timeline, Temporary Character Death, Character Turned Into a Ghost, Tony Stark and Magic, Mutual Pining, Touch-Starved, Both of them, Hurt/Comfort, Emotional Hurt/Comfort, First Kiss, Romance, Happy Ending, Fade to Black, but you can imagine where this is going, the plot and the action are in the first chapter, the second one is just pure romantic fluff

blog.name: zajelimilogin
blog.title: Dream a little bigger, darling.
blog.description:
Woman.
Determined.
Braided.

What else?
Normality is overrated.
Wibbly wobbly, timey wimey.
Black, two sugars. I'll be upstairs.
One more miracle, please.

You mustn't be afraid to dream a little bigger, darling.

title: Baby Alpha
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2R5WHGp

by theMadStarker

Alpha Peter was finally going through his first rut but he had a problem. No amount of pleasure was enough. He needed an omega.

Omega Tony finds out, and takes pity on the painfully inexperienced alpha.

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: I will always be here
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2yU5fsx

by SugarCloud15

Peter Parker was a normal kid, except for two things:

1)He was Tony Stark’s son. (but he kept his mother’s name after she had died)
2)He had cancer.

Peter is sick. Tony is overprotective. Ned is a sweetheart. MJ is quietly supportive.
The Avengers are just watching and supporting from the sidelines.

Words: 1217, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies)

by SugarCloud15

Peter Parker was a normal kid, except for two things:

1)He was Tony Stark’s son. (but he kept his mother’s name after she had died)
2)He had cancer.

Peter is sick. Tony is overprotective. Ned is a sweetheart. MJ is quietly supportive.
The Avengers are just watching and supporting from the sidelines.

summary:
Jet Fighter
(Peter Parker x OC Female)
Description: Jet is a girl with wings and superhuman strength. Need I say more?
CHAPTER...
body:
Jet Fighter

(Peter Parker x OC Female)

Description: Jet is a girl with wings and superhuman strength. Need I say more?

CHAPTER 2-

Strike A Deal

Jet’s eyes flickered open for a moment. She took a gasping breath, trying to sit up. She was on a helicopter.

“Stay still.” Sam murmured from somewhere outside of her line of vision. She twisted her head around to see him sitting in a chair, his arms strapped down and his wrists cuffed together. She spotted Scott Lang, Wanda, and Clint sitting next to him, restrained in similar ways.

Jet opened her mouth to say something but Sam shook his head.

“Shhh.” Sam whispered. Jet nodded and she drifted back to sleep.

When she woke back up, someone was carrying her. She tried to move, but her body screamed in pain. She opened her eyes and saw it was an armed guard carrying her. Sam walked in front of her, lead by another guard.

“Sir, she’s awake.” The guard carrying her said as they entered a white room. Her friends were led to separate cells and the doors were locked.

“Get her restrained.” Sergeant Ross ordered. Two other guards walked forward and grabbed hold of Jet’s arms as the other carrying her set her down. With no intent of being gentle, the guards held her still as her wrists were cuffed together and her ankles were chained.

A black strap was wrapped around her shoulders and tightened around her wings. She let out a cry as she felt her bones crack under the restraint. Another strap went around her waist and tightened around the bottom part of her wings.

“Let her go! You’re hurting her!” Sam shouted from his cell, banging a fist against the glass.

“Take her to the lab.” Ross instructed. Jet was dragged from the cell block as she struggled against her restraints.

“Let me go!” She screamed. She locked eyes with Sam just before the doors closed.

“You’ll be okay, Jet!” He called after her. But both of them highly doubted that.

***

“Where’s Jet?” Tony asked, his eyes wandering  around the cell block. There was one empty cell next to Clint and Wanda. Tony turned back to Sam, whose held tilted to the side, his arms crossed.

“Where do you think?” Sam snapped. “Do you really think that they’d leave a scientific marvel like her alone?” Tony’s face paled.

“I told them not to touch her.” He said, feeling like he was trying to reassure himself more than Sam.

“And yet where were you when we were all forced to watch them tie her wings down and drag her to the lab, listening to her screaming the whole way.” Tony didn’t speak so Sam continued, “we told her she would be fine. That even though we were caught, you wouldn’t let a 15 year old girl get locked up. But I guess we misjudged you.”

***

Tony sat alone in a dimly lit room, his arms crossed as he anxiously tapped his foot. The door opened and he looked up. A guard had a tight hold on Jet’s arm, pulling her into the room. She was still bruised and bloodied from the battle even though that was over a week ago. Her wrists were cuffed and a long chain connected them to her ankles, which were also cuffed. Her wings were forcibly folded tightly against her back and held down with two thick black straps.

The guard forced her down into the chair across from Tony. Without a nod to Tony, the guard left, closing the door behind him. Tony sighed and locked eyes with Jet.

“Hey kid.” He whispered.

“Hey.” She answered, breaking their eye contact and looking down.

“What did they do to you?” He asked. Jet, without moving her head, looked over to the camera in the upper corner of the room. Tony smirked.

“I hacked the system. Muted the audio and looped the footage.” Jet looked up at him.

“Then they’ll come back in here.”

“Bolted the door. Now tell me, what have they done?” Tony pressed.

“Why would you care?” Jet spat, “you’re the one who got me locked up in the first place.”

“I told them to keep you safe. This isn’t what I had in mind.” Tony explained. Jet scoffed and sat back, but winced as her wings made contact with the back of the chair.

“I can’t help you if you don’t tell me what they did.” Tony added quieter. He could see the exhaustion in Jet’s eyes, as if she hadn’t slept since she got here. And she was thinner, not by much, since she was already a rail, but Tony could tell.

“It’s more like what they haven’t done.” Jet said. Tony nodded for her to continue. Jet sighed.

“My wings are broken. And they won’t allow me to stretch them out. Any longer with them held down by these straps and they’ll heal wrong. Then I’ll be in pain for the rest of my life. And I’m covered in injuries that they refuse to look at.”

Tony sat forward, knowing there was something more.

“But they have done something. Haven’t they?” He pressed. Jet squirmed under his stare and nodded slightly.

“They do…experiments… try to test my limits. Since I’m a scientific breakthrough and all.”

“Steve sent me a message. To make sure you’re safe. And I intend to do that.”

***

Jet was escorted back to her cell block, where she was unceremoniously pushed to the ground and the door was locked before she could even sit up.

“What’d they do this time?” Sam asked from his cell. His fists were clenched and his face held a permanent glare. The second his doors opened, he swore he would kill every last person who hurt the winged girl. Jet sighed.

“Nothing this time.” She whispered back. “Tony wanted to see me.”

“Stark’s here?” Sam spat. He was the reason Jet was even in this mess. Jet merely nodded.

“What did he want?” Clint asked, leaning against the glass. Jet shrugged slightly, not wanting the camera’s to hear what Tony was actually doing. Clint didn’t press for information, pushing himself off the glass and sitting down on his bed. Sam remained standing, pacing back and forth. 

“How are you feeling?” Wanda asked. Jet looked over to the other girl’s cell block. She looked tired and her hair hung limp against her shoulders. Like Jet, Wanda remained bound. The others were free to roam around their cells, while Wanda was restricted in a straight jacket. Jet would’ve worn a straight jacket too, only it didn’t fit over her wings. 

“I’m okay.” Jet responded. Wanda sent her a pointed look. 

“I know you’re not.” She said. Jet didn’t say anything, pulling herself up onto her bed and laying down on her side. She drifted into an uneasy sleep, her body screaming in pain. 

***

Tony tapped his fingers against the metal table impatiently waiting for Secretary Ross. The gray haired man walked in and Tony stood up. 

“I want you to release Jet.” He demanded. 

“She’s a criminal. Along with everyone else here.” Ross answered, shutting the door.

“She’s a child!”

“That doesn’t change anything.” 

“That still doesn’t constitute experimentation.” Tony said through clenched teeth. 

“We haven’t done any-” Tony slammed his fist against the table.

“Don’t lie to me! Jet told me as much.” Ross held his hands up in surrender.

“Alright, alright. We may have done a few blood tests, but that’t all!” He said.

“I’m willing to strike a deal with you, Ross. So that Jet can go free, and you won’t have to worry about her acting out again.” Tony said, sitting down. 

“What’d you have in mind?”

***

Jet woke up with a start as her cell door was being unlocked. Sitting up, she cowered in the corner of her bed, hoping that maybe this once, they weren’t going to hurt her. The door swung open and Tony stood there. 

“Come on, kid. You’re getting out of here.” 

Tag list:

@ginger-elf-queen

“But they have done something. Haven’t they?” He pressed. Jet squirmed under his stare and nodded slightly.

“They do…experiments… try to test my limits. Since I’m a scientific breakthrough and all.”

“Steve sent me a message. To make sure you’re safe. And I intend to do that.”

***

Jet was escorted back to her cell block, where she was unceremoniously pushed to the ground and the door was locked before she could even sit up.

“What’d they do this time?” Sam asked from his cell. His fists were clenched and his face held a permanent glare. The second his doors opened, he swore he would kill every last person who hurt the winged girl. Jet sighed.

“Nothing this time.” She whispered back. “Tony wanted to see me.”

“Stark’s here?” Sam spat. He was the reason Jet was even in this mess. Jet merely nodded.

“What did he want?” Clint asked, leaning against the glass. Jet shrugged slightly, not wanting the camera’s to hear what Tony was actually doing. Clint didn’t press for information, pushing himself off the glass and sitting down on his bed. Sam remained standing, pacing back and forth. 

“How are you feeling?” Wanda asked. Jet looked over to the other girl’s cell block. She looked tired and her hair hung limp against her shoulders. Like Jet, Wanda remained bound. The others were free to roam around their cells, while Wanda was restricted in a straight jacket. Jet would’ve worn a straight jacket too, only it didn’t fit over her wings. 

“I’m okay.” Jet responded. Wanda sent her a pointed look. 

“I know you’re not.” She said. Jet didn’t say anything, pulling herself up onto her bed and laying down on her side. She drifted into an uneasy sleep, her body screaming in pain. 

***

Tony tapped his fingers against the metal table impatiently waiting for Secretary Ross. The gray haired man walked in and Tony stood up. 

“I want you to release Jet.” He demanded. 

“She’s a criminal. Along with everyone else here.” Ross answered, shutting the door.

“She’s a child!”

“That doesn’t change anything.” 

“That still doesn’t constitute experimentation.” Tony said through clenched teeth. 

“We haven’t done any-” Tony slammed his fist against the table.

“Don’t lie to me! Jet told me as much.” Ross held his hands up in surrender.

“Alright, alright. We may have done a few blood tests, but that’t all!” He said.

“I’m willing to strike a deal with you, Ross. So that Jet can go free, and you won’t have to worry about her acting out again.” Tony said, sitting down. 

“What’d you have in mind?”

***

Jet woke up with a start as her cell door was being unlocked. Sitting up, she cowered in the corner of her bed, hoping that maybe this once, they weren’t going to hurt her. The door swung open and Tony stood there. 

“Come on, kid. You’re getting out of here.”
